intro: Pluchea tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Pluchea tenuifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
